subject: Re: [junit] debugging techniques
msgSnippet: ... Someone on this list once mentioned using fails to facilitate a sort of discovery programming.  That might be applicable in this case. The value that
messageBody:
On Monday, April 21, 2003, at 02:17 PM, junitguy wrote:

> I tried to use System.out.println() to print the values of variables,
> but the output seems to be redirected. How do I debug tests?

Someone on this list once mentioned using fails to facilitate a sort of
discovery programming. That might be applicable in this case.

The value that you're interested in printing, you're probably
interested in it because you don't know it or are now unsure of its
behavior. Why not write it as a failure instead of printing it
("fail(value)" instead of "System.out.println(value)"). Run the test.
You'll see what the value is in the failure. Then, rewrite the fail as
an assert statement to ensure that the interesting value behaves as
expected.

-shane
